page.title: 18FARMING IN CRANHAM
page.content: Upminster has open countryside to the north,east and west and much is{good {agricultural land.}London clay soils dominate and with gentle relief provide good land for{cereals}on the better drained sites and for{potatoes {and pasture}on heavier soils.The presence of chalk increases woodland cover to the north and the sand and gravel deposits to the south provide home for both{vegetables}(mainly brassics) and for commercial quarring. Although climate and soils influence the land use pattern economic considerations are also very important,not least the closeness of the London market,and values are high and{farming is extensive.}Vegetables and soft fruit are grown for the very large local market and there are several'self pick'farms close by.Dairy farming has been replaced by cereals.
